author: Luc Jose A.
title: Crypto : Le Bitcoin, Ethereum et Solana à la peine, mais Ripple surprend tout le monde !
text:
Crypto : Le Bitcoin, Ethereum et Solana à la peine, mais Ripple surprend tout le monde !
S'informer▪
Trading
Le marché des cryptos traverse une phase critique, avec des oscillations entre baisses marquées et hausses inattendues. Alors que le Bitcoin et l’Ethereum continuent leur repli, certaines cryptos comme Ripple s’illustrent par des performances spectaculaires, ce qui alimente débats et spéculations sur l’avenir du secteur. Ce climat d’incertitude, exacerbé par des pressions externes et une volatilité accrue, appelle les investisseurs à la prudence.
Le déclin des poids lourds et contrastes saisissants
Le Bitcoin, considéré comme l’étalon du secteur, accuse un recul de 2 % en l’espace de 24 heures, pour s’échanger autour de 89 184 $. Cette baisse reflète une perte de momentum, alors que la capitalisation globale du marché diminue de 1,67 %, avec 2,29 trillions de dollars. Dans ce contexte, Ethereum n’est pas épargné, et affiche une chute de 4 % pour se stabiliser à 3 098 $, tandis que Solana, en retrait de 3 %, s’échange à 213 $. Ces performances moroses traduisent un affaiblissement général des grands acteurs du marché.
Malgré ce climat de morosité, le Ripple (XRP) s’est distingué par une progression exceptionnelle de 15 %, avec un prix de 0,81 $. Il s’impose comme le plus grand gagnant de la journée. Hedera (HBAR), de son côté, a bondi de 13 %, et séduit les investisseurs avec un prix de 0,06669 $. Ces hausses, bien qu’isolées, témoignent de la résilience de certaines cryptos face à la tourmente.
Les perspectives et implications : entre défis et opportunités
Parallèlement à ces fluctuations, des signaux mitigés viennent amplifier l’incertitude. Les mineurs de Bitcoin ont transféré 25 000 BTC vers des plateformes d’échange, ce qui intensifie les craintes d’une pression de vente accrue. De même, Ethereum peine à franchir le seuil psychologique des 4 000 $, ce qui alimente le doute parmi les investisseurs institutionnels et particuliers. Sur un autre front, Solana fait face à des défis liés à des régulations renforcées et à des mises à jour réseau controversées, source de volatilité.
Cette instabilité offre cependant des opportunités aux traders résilients. Grâce à une capitalisation sur les performances divergentes des cryptos, les investisseurs bien informés pourraient tirer parti de cette phase critique. Néanmoins, les perspectives restent complexes. À long terme, le marché devra démontrer une capacité à absorber ces chocs et à innover pour la restauration de la confiance.
Dans ce climat incertain, la nécessité d’une stratégie rigoureuse et d’une veille constante est plus que jamais capitale. Si les dernières tendances soulignent les risques inhérents à cet écosystème, elles rappellent également la nature intrinsèquement imprévisible, mais prometteuse des cryptos.

author: Enviroliteracy Team
title: Can black panthers be tamed?
text:
Can Black Panthers Be Tamed? The Truth Behind These Majestic Creatures Can black panthers be tamed? The straightforward answer is a resounding no . While the allure of interacting with such a magnificent and powerful animal is understandable, the reality is that black panthers, which are actually melanistic (dark-coated) variants of leopards and jaguars , possess ingrained wild instincts that cannot be eliminated through training or domestication. Attempts to “tame” them are not only dangerous for humans but also detrimental to the well-being of the animal, depriving it of its natural environment and behaviors. These are apex predators wired for survival in the wild, not cuddly companions for your living room.
Understanding the Nature of Black Panthers To understand why taming a black panther is impossible, we must first understand what they are. It’s crucial to remember that “black panther” is not a distinct species. It’s a term used to describe leopards and jaguars with melanism , a genetic condition that causes an overproduction of melanin, resulting in a black coat.
Wild Instincts: The Untamable Core Both leopards and jaguars, regardless of their coat color, are inherently wild animals . Millions of years of evolution have shaped their behavior, instincts, and physical capabilities to thrive in the wild. These include:
Hunting Prowess: Their bodies are built for hunting, stalking, and killing prey. Their instincts drive them to pursue and dominate. Territoriality: Both leopards and jaguars are territorial animals that fiercely defend their space. This instinct can translate into aggression towards humans encroaching on their perceived territory. Solitary Nature: These big cats are largely solitary creatures, preferring to live and hunt alone. This independence makes them less adaptable to the social demands of living with humans. Unpredictability: Wild animals, even those raised in captivity, retain a degree of unpredictability. A seemingly calm panther can quickly become aggressive if triggered by a perceived threat. The Illusion of Taming While some individuals may claim to have “tamed” a black panther, what they’ve likely accomplished is a level of habituation or learned behavior . These animals may tolerate human presence and even perform certain tricks for rewards, but this doesn’t equate to genuine domestication. Domestication is a generations-long process of selective breeding to fundamentally alter an animal’s genetic makeup and temperament. Black panthers have not undergone this process.
Ethical and Legal Considerations Beyond the practical impossibility of taming a black panther, there are also significant ethical and legal implications.
Animal Welfare: Confining a large, wild animal to a domestic environment deprives it of its natural needs and behaviors. This can lead to stress, physical and psychological problems, and a significantly reduced quality of life. The Environmental Literacy Council , enviroliteracy.org, advocates for understanding and respecting the needs of all animals in their natural habitats. Public Safety: Keeping a black panther poses a significant risk to public safety. Even with the best intentions, accidents can happen. An escaped panther could cause serious injury or death to humans and other animals. Legal Restrictions: Most jurisdictions have strict laws prohibiting the ownership of dangerous wild animals like black panthers. These laws are in place to protect both the public and the animals themselves. FAQs: Your Burning Questions Answered Can you own a black panther as a pet? No. It is illegal in most places to own a black panther, and it’s ethically irresponsible due to the animal’s needs and potential danger.
Are black panthers friendly to humans? No , they are not inherently friendly. They are wild animals that may tolerate humans in certain situations but are not domesticated or naturally inclined to be friendly.
What is the safest big cat to own? There is no safe big cat to own as a pet. They are all wild animals with inherent risks. Some domesticated cat breeds, like the Maine Coon, are larger and have a more docile temperament, but they are still domestic cats.
Can you raise a panther from a cub? While it might seem tempting to raise a panther cub, doing so does not change its wild instincts. Even a hand-raised panther will retain its predatory drive and potential for aggression.
Can black panthers mate with other leopards or jaguars? Yes, black panthers can mate with other leopards or jaguars. The resulting offspring may or may not inherit the melanistic gene.
Would a black panther attack a human? A black panther is unlikely to attack a human unprovoked, but they may attack if they feel threatened, are protecting their territory, or are extremely hungry.
Are there black panthers in the United States? The existence of black panthers in the wild in the United States is largely considered folklore . While melanistic jaguars are found in Central and South America, there is little credible evidence to support the existence of black leopards or jaguars in the US.
What do black panthers eat? Their diet consists primarily of wild hog, white-tailed deer, raccoons , and other mammals, depending on their geographical location.
How long do black panthers live? In the wild, they typically live for 12 years . In captivity, with proper care, they can live up to 20 years .
Can you tame a jaguar or leopard in general? No. Regardless of coat color, jaguars and leopards are wild animals that cannot be truly tamed.
What should you do if you encounter a black panther in the wild? Make yourself appear large , make noise, and back away slowly. Do not run or turn your back.
Are black panthers stronger than lions or tigers? Generally, lions and tigers are larger and stronger than black panthers (leopards and jaguars), giving them an advantage in a fight.
Why are black panthers solitary animals? Their solitary nature is driven by their need to efficiently hunt and conserve resources. It minimizes competition for food and territory.
Do panthers like humans? Panthers are generally indifferent to humans and want very little to do with us. They do not view humans as prey.
Is it cruel to keep a black panther in captivity? Yes, it is considered cruel . Captivity deprives them of their natural environment, behaviors, and social interactions, leading to significant stress and a reduced quality of life.
Conclusion The mystique surrounding black panthers is undeniable, but it’s crucial to separate fantasy from reality. These are magnificent wild animals that deserve to live in their natural habitats, free from human interference. Attempting to tame them is not only dangerous but also ethically reprehensible. Let’s admire these creatures from afar, supporting conservation efforts that ensure their survival in the wild, where they truly belong.

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Watch: Eagles Unveil Season Preview With Jason Kelce, Fletcher Cox
text:
By Nick Faria ,
2 hours ago As is the case with every season, the Philadelphia Eagles have unveiled a new hype video to get fans ready for the start of the new season.
Retired Eagle Jason Kelce, wearing a shirt that promotes his Legend Edition Chunky soup can on March 20, 2024. Jim Walsh &sol USA TODAY NETWORK &sol USA TODAY NETWORK
Just because the team may look different than in years past, though, doesn't mean that the organization isn't going back to its roots to get fans excited for a new year.
Philadelphia brought back recently retired stars in All-Pros Fletcher Cox and Jason Kelce as part of their central "Yo" campaign that showed the team focused not only on their upcoming matchup against the Green Bay Packers but also on their thoughts on the year ahead.
The full video can be found here:
Philadelphia is looking to bounce back from one of the worst collapses in franchise history when they lost six of their final seven games including a 32-9 wild card loss to the Tampa Bay Buccaneers.
Going into the new year, Philadelphia addressed key positions across the roster including adding Saquon Barkley, Bryce Huff, and C.J. Gardner-Johnson.
The Eagles are hoping their big offseason is more than enough to put them over the top when it comes to dominating at the highest level once again.
Related: DeSean Full of '(Bleep),' Claims Angry Davante
Their latest hype video is just the latest example.
Expand All Read in NewsBreak

author: Yahoo Life Shopping
title: 'The truck was freed!': These traction mats can get your car out of a snow jam and they're just $19
text:
'The truck was freed!': These traction mats can get your car out of a snow jam and they're just $19 Patrick Hearn · Deals Writer, Tech January 13, 2024 at 1:39 PM 26
This is turning out to be a banger of a winter! If you don't want to get into any sticky driving situations — we've got an ounce of prevention for those times when the conditions are quite as slick as you need them to be. We're talking about the WawaAuto All-Weather Traction Mats — they're portable, easy-to-store mats that can give your tires something to grab onto when nothing else is available — and they're only $19.
WawaAuto WawaAuto All-Weather Foldable Auto Traction Mat $19 $22 Save $3 Designed with cars in mind, these traction mats take up little space and can easily be stored in the trunk for when mud gets you down.
$19 at Amazon Why is this a good deal? If you get stuck in mud or ice, it can derail your entire day. This is an inexpensive gadget that can save you from an expensive problem, especially when you consider the average cost of a tow truck is around $100. Competing products cost $60 or more and aren't as easy to store, either!
Why do I need this? The wet whirring sound of a firmly-lodged tire is one we all dread. It usually means you're going nowhere fast unless you have someone to help push the car out of the hole — and even then, that person will likely end up covered head to toe in mud. The problem is that tires need something solid to grip, and mud provides no traction.
The WawaAuto Traction Mats slide in front of and under your tire to give your vehicle something to propel off of. Each one is capable of handling up to 3.5 tons of weight, and they give you an option for getting yourself out of a sticky situation. Better yet, these are specifically designed for cars, not trucks, so they fit easily into your trunk and can be kept on-hand for when they're needed.
Un-stuck yourself with these portable traction mats. (Photo: Amazon) What reviewers say
"Great for icy traction," one driver said . "Just used these on a FWD car trying to get up a steep pure ice driveway in MN. Took like 2 seconds to unfold, didn’t have to shove under tires that far. They didn’t move a bit on the ice as the car tires gripped it and easily moved. Great product so far. Got them to use for camper and SUV."
Another reviewer wrote , "I have used these two times so far for getting unstuck. The first time was last year with my wife's Hyundai Elantra that was stuck in some deep wet snow. Second time I just used them with a big rear-wheel drive passenger van that was stuck on some snow and ice trying to get up a slightly inclined driveway. Worked well both times! I am giving these 5 stars and would definitely buy again."
"Two of these, folded and stacked, measure 7x11x2 inches — easily stowable under a car seat. Probably they don't work as well as the full-sized traction boards, but you have to be a dedicated off-roader with plenty of roof rack space to carry those. I judge that these would be plenty sturdy enough and work well, on snow," said another shopper .
"Our elderly neighbor hadn’t cleared the snow by their mailbox ... the mail truck got stuck," shared a five-star fan . "All of the neighbors gathered around, trying to help. They had shovels, ice melt, boards… three men tried to push the truck free. I’d bought these as a 'just in case something ever happens' ... we slid them under the back tires of the mail truck and with a little more pushing from the front the truck was freed!"
WawaAuto WawaAuto All-Weather Foldable Auto Traction Mat $19 $22 Save $3 When bad driving conditions strike, don't spend your day in a rut — use these traction mats to get yourself out and back on the road.
$19 at Amazon Need some extra cold weather roadside assistance? This gadget can clear up snow off your car in a jiffy.
Snow Joe Snow Joe LED 4-In-1 Telescoping Snow Broom and Ice Scraper $20 One end can clear snow with a simple swipe, while the scraper on the other breaks up ice on the windshield.
$20 at Amazon "Living in northern Wisconsin, I wish I had known of these sooner," lamented a grateful reviewer . "They work amazingly. I will never use a regular snowbrush again. These allow me to take a large amount of snow off in one stroke — and I can even reach my SUV roof with the telescoping handle! I also love the material it is made of; the foam does not get wet, so no more throwing a snow-wet brush in my car. I highly recommend it — bought one for myself and three for gifts."
If you have Amazon Prime , you’ll get free shipping, of course. Not yet a member? No problem. You can Prime $25 or more.)

author: NewsBreak Original
title: NJ Priest Arrested For Drunk Driving, Stealing From Walmart Stepping Down: Officials
text: A New Jersey priest arrested for shoplifting and drunk driving is stepping down from his pulpit, Daily Voice has learned. Dawid Wejnerowski, the now-former priest of the St. Mary's Catholic Church in Alpha, had a blood alcohol level more than twice the legal limit when Pohatcong police pulled him over on suspicion of shoplifting from Walmart on Monday, Feb. 19 around 10:15 p.m., Police Chief Scott Robb said. Officers approached the priest's vehicle, pointed out to them by a Walmart employee in the store parking lot, but Wejnerowski backed the car out of a parking spot and drove off from the officer's patrol car, which had its lights and sirens activated, Robb said. Wejnerowski drove erratically through the Parkside section of Pohatcong Township and came to a stop in a front yard on Liberty Boulevard, the chief said. The priest was arrested and removed from the vehicle. After apprehending him, police found the items he snatched from Walmart and open containers of alcohol in his crr, Robb said. Wejnerowski was charged with shoplifting, eluding police, driving while intoxicated, and multiple other traffic offenses. Wejnerowski's blood alcohol level was 0.21%. The legal driving limit in New Jersey is .08%. He was released pending a court date. A spokesman for the diocese of Metuchen said the priest would be stepping aside to seek inpatient treatment out of state. "It is clear, Fr. Dawid has a very serious problem with alcohol. He has accepted this fact, the first step in recovery," said Anthony Kearns, III, Chancellor of the Diocese of Metuchen. "Fr. is extremely remorseful for his conduct. He is aware of the danger he posed to others and himself. He is resolved to seek the necessary treatment to ensure he never engages in such behavior again.
